Specimen Type: Body fluids (pleural, ascitic, cerebrospinal fluid), urine, brushings, washings, fine needle aspirates from non-gynecologic sites
Purpose: To prepare, stain, examine, and interpret non-gynecologic cytology specimens for the detection of benign, atypical, or malignant cellular changes
Container: Sterile leak-proof container or ThinPrep/SurePath vial with appropriate fixative (e.g., alcohol, Saccomanno’s fixative); glass slides for direct smears
Equipment: Centrifuge or cytocentrifuge, microscopes (4x–100x objectives), staining apparatus for Papanicolaou and related cytology stains
